00042 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_ECHO
00043 
00044 #include <obd_support.h>

00052 /* The echo objid needs to be below 2^32, because regular FID numbers are
00053  * limited to 2^32 objects in f_oid for the FID_SEQ_ECHO range. b=23335 */
00054 #define ECHO_INIT_OID        0x10000000ULL
00055 #define ECHO_HANDLE_MAGIC    0xabcd0123fedc9876ULL
00056 
00057 #define ECHO_PERSISTENT_PAGES (ECHO_PERSISTENT_SIZE >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT)
00058 static struct page *echo_persistent_pages[ECHO_PERSISTENT_PAGES];
00059 
00060 enum {
00061         LPROC_ECHO_READ_BYTES = 1,
00062         LPROC_ECHO_WRITE_BYTES = 2,
00063         LPROC_ECHO_LAST = LPROC_ECHO_WRITE_BYTES +1
00064 };
00065 
00066 static int echo_connect(const struct lu_env *env,
00067                         struct obd_export **exp, struct obd_device *obd,
00068                         struct obd_uuid *cluuid, struct obd_connect_data *data,
00069                         void *localdata)
00070 {
00071         struct lustre_handle conn = { 0 };
00072         int rc;
00073 
00074         data->ocd_connect_flags &= ECHO_CONNECT_SUPPORTED;
00075         rc = class_connect(&conn, obd, cluuid);
00076         if (rc) {
00077                 CERROR("can't connect %d\n", rc);
00078                 return rc;
00079         }
00080         *exp = class_conn2export(&conn);
00081 
00082         return 0;
00083 }
00084 
00085 static int echo_disconnect(struct obd_export *exp)
00086 {
00087         LASSERT (exp != NULL);
00088 
00089         return server_disconnect_export(exp);
00090 }

00092 static int echo_init_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00093 {
00094         return ldlm_init_export(exp);
00095 }
00096 
00097 static int echo_destroy_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00098 {
00099         ENTRY;
00100 
00101         target_destroy_export(exp);
00102         ldlm_destroy_export(exp);
00103 
00104         RETURN(0);
00105 }

00107 static u64 echo_next_id(struct obd_device *obddev)
00108 {
00109         u64 id;
00110 
00111         spin_lock(&obddev->u.echo.eo_lock);
00112         id = ++obddev->u.echo.eo_lastino;
00113         spin_unlock(&obddev->u.echo.eo_lock);
00114 
00115         return id;
00116 }
00117 
00118 static int echo_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00119                        struct obdo *oa)
00120 {
00121         struct obd_device *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
00122 
00123         if (!obd) {
00124                 CERROR("invalid client cookie "LPX64"\n",
00125                        exp->exp_handle.h_cookie);
00126                 return -EINVAL;
00127         }
00128 
00129         if (!(oa->o_mode & S_IFMT)) {
00130                 CERROR("echo obd: no type!\n");
00131                 return -ENOENT;
00132         }
00133 
00134         if (!(oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLTYPE)) {
00135                 CERROR("invalid o_valid "LPX64"\n", oa->o_valid);
00136                 return -EINVAL;
00137         }
00138 
00139         ostid_set_seq_echo(&oa->o_oi);
00140         ostid_set_id(&oa->o_oi, echo_next_id(obd));
00141         oa->o_valid = OBD_MD_FLID;
00142 
00143         return 0;
00144 }
00145 
00146 static int echo_destroy(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00147                         struct obdo *oa)
00148 {
00149         struct obd_device *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
00150 
00151         ENTRY;
00152         if (!obd) {
00153                 CERROR("invalid client cookie "LPX64"\n",
00154                        exp->exp_handle.h_cookie);
00155                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00156         }
00157 
00158         if (!(oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLID)) {
00159                 CERROR("obdo missing FLID valid flag: "LPX64"\n", oa->o_valid);
00160                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00161         }
00162 
00163         if (ostid_id(&oa->o_oi) > obd->u.echo.eo_lastino ||
00164             ostid_id(&oa->o_oi) < ECHO_INIT_OID) {
00165                 CERROR("bad destroy objid: "DOSTID"\n", POSTID(&oa->o_oi));
00166                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00167         }
00168 
00169         RETURN(0);
00170 }
00171 
00172 static int echo_getattr(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00173                         struct obdo *oa)
00174 {
00175         struct obd_device *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
00176         u64 id = ostid_id(&oa->o_oi);
00177 
00178         ENTRY;
00179         if (!obd) {
00180                 CERROR("invalid client cookie "LPX64"\n",
00181                        exp->exp_handle.h_cookie);
00182                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00183         }
00184 
00185         if (!(oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLID)) {
00186                 CERROR("obdo missing FLID valid flag: "LPX64"\n", oa->o_valid);
00187                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00188         }
00189 
00190         obdo_cpy_md(oa, &obd->u.echo.eo_oa, oa->o_valid);
00191         ostid_set_seq_echo(&oa->o_oi);
00192         ostid_set_id(&oa->o_oi, id);
00193 
00194         RETURN(0);
00195 }
00196 
00197 static int echo_setattr(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00198                         struct obdo *oa)
00199 {
00200         struct obd_device *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
00201 
00202         ENTRY;
00203         if (!obd) {
00204                 CERROR("invalid client cookie "LPX64"\n",
00205                        exp->exp_handle.h_cookie);
00206                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00207         }
00208 
00209         if (!(oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLID)) {
00210                 CERROR("obdo missing FLID valid flag: "LPX64"\n", oa->o_valid);
00211                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00212         }
00213 
00214         obd->u.echo.eo_oa = *oa;
00215 
00216         RETURN(0);
00217 }
00218 
00219 static void
00220 echo_page_debug_setup(struct page *page, int rw, u64 id,
00221                       __u64 offset, int len)
00222 {
00223         int   page_offset = offset & ~PAGE_MASK;
00224         char *addr        = ((char *)kmap(page)) + page_offset;
00225 
00226         if (len % OBD_ECHO_BLOCK_SIZE != 0)
00227                 CERROR("Unexpected block size %d\n", len);
00228 
00229         while (len > 0) {
00230                 if (rw & OBD_BRW_READ)
00231                         block_debug_setup(addr, OBD_ECHO_BLOCK_SIZE,
00232                                           offset, id);
00233                 else
00234                         block_debug_setup(addr, OBD_ECHO_BLOCK_SIZE,
00235                                           0xecc0ecc0ecc0ecc0ULL,
00236                                           0xecc0ecc0ecc0ecc0ULL);
00237 
00238                 addr   += OBD_ECHO_BLOCK_SIZE;
00239                 offset += OBD_ECHO_BLOCK_SIZE;
00240                 len    -= OBD_ECHO_BLOCK_SIZE;
00241         }
00242 
00243         kunmap(page);
00244 }
00245 
00246 static int
00247 echo_page_debug_check(struct page *page, u64 id,
00248                       __u64 offset, int len)
00249 {
00250         int   page_offset = offset & ~PAGE_MASK;
00251         char *addr        = ((char *)kmap(page)) + page_offset;
00252         int   rc          = 0;
00253         int   rc2;
00254 
00255         if (len % OBD_ECHO_BLOCK_SIZE != 0)
00256                 CERROR("Unexpected block size %d\n", len);
00257 
00258         while (len > 0) {
00259                 rc2 = block_debug_check("echo", addr, OBD_ECHO_BLOCK_SIZE,
00260                                         offset, id);
00261 
00262                 if (rc2 != 0 && rc == 0)
00263                         rc = rc2;
00264 
00265                 addr   += OBD_ECHO_BLOCK_SIZE;
00266                 offset += OBD_ECHO_BLOCK_SIZE;
00267                 len    -= OBD_ECHO_BLOCK_SIZE;
00268         }
00269 
00270         kunmap(page);
00271 
00272         return rc;
00273 }
00274 
00275 static int echo_map_nb_to_lb(struct obdo *oa, struct obd_ioobj *obj,
00276                              struct niobuf_remote *nb, int *pages,
00277                              struct niobuf_local *lb, int cmd, int *left)
00278 {
00279         gfp_t gfp_mask = (ostid_id(&obj->ioo_oid) & 1) ?
00280                         GFP_HIGHUSER : GFP_KERNEL;
00281         int ispersistent = ostid_id(&obj->ioo_oid) == ECHO_PERSISTENT_OBJID;
00282         int debug_setup = (!ispersistent &&
00283                            (oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS) != 0 &&
00284                            (oa->o_flags & OBD_FL_DEBUG_CHECK) != 0);
00285         struct niobuf_local *res = lb;
00286         u64 offset = nb->rnb_offset;
00287         int len = nb->rnb_len;
00288 
00289         while (len > 0) {
00290                 int plen = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - (offset & (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE-1));
00291                 if (len < plen)
00292                         plen = len;
00293 
00294                 /* check for local buf overflow */
00295                 if (*left == 0)
00296                         return -EINVAL;
00297 
00298                 res->lnb_file_offset = offset;
00299                 res->lnb_len = plen;
00300                 LASSERT((res->lnb_file_offset & ~PAGE_MASK) +
00301                         res->lnb_len <= PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00302 
00303                 if (ispersistent &&
00304                     ((res->lnb_file_offset >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT) <
00305                       ECHO_PERSISTENT_PAGES)) {
00306                         res->lnb_page =
00307                                 echo_persistent_pages[res->lnb_file_offset >>
00308                                                       PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT];
00309                         /* Take extra ref so __free_pages() can be called OK */
00310                         get_page(res->lnb_page);
00311                 } else {
00312                         res->lnb_page = alloc_page(gfp_mask);
00313                         if (res->lnb_page == NULL) {
00314                                 CERROR("can't get page for id " DOSTID"\n",
00315                                        POSTID(&obj->ioo_oid));
00316                                 return -ENOMEM;
00317                         }
00318                 }
00319 
00320                 CDEBUG(D_PAGE, "$$$$ get page %p @ "LPU64" for %d\n",
00321                        res->lnb_page, res->lnb_file_offset, res->lnb_len);
00322 
00323                 if (cmd & OBD_BRW_READ)
00324                         res->lnb_rc = res->lnb_len;
00325 
00326                 if (debug_setup)
00327                         echo_page_debug_setup(res->lnb_page, cmd,
00328                                               ostid_id(&obj->ioo_oid),
00329                                               res->lnb_file_offset,
00330                                               res->lnb_len);
00331 
00332                 offset += plen;
00333                 len -= plen;
00334                 res++;
00335 
00336                 (*left)--;
00337                 (*pages)++;
00338         }
00339 
00340         return 0;
00341 }
00342 
00343 static int echo_finalize_lb(struct obdo *oa, struct obd_ioobj *obj,
00344                             struct niobuf_remote *rb, int *pgs,
00345                             struct niobuf_local *lb, int verify)
00346 {
00347         struct niobuf_local *res = lb;
00348         u64 start = rb->rnb_offset >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00349         u64 end   = (rb->rnb_offset + rb->rnb_len + PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1) >>
00350                     PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00351         int     count  = (int)(end - start);
00352         int     rc     = 0;
00353         int     i;
00354 
00355         for (i = 0; i < count; i++, (*pgs) ++, res++) {
00356                 struct page *page = res->lnb_page;
00357                 void       *addr;
00358 
00359                 if (page == NULL) {
00360                         CERROR("null page objid "LPU64":%p, buf %d/%d\n",
00361                                ostid_id(&obj->ioo_oid), page, i,
00362                                obj->ioo_bufcnt);
00363                         return -EFAULT;
00364                 }
00365 
00366                 addr = kmap(page);
00367 
00368                 CDEBUG(D_PAGE, "$$$$ use page %p, addr %p@"LPU64"\n",
00369                        res->lnb_page, addr, res->lnb_file_offset);
00370 
00371                 if (verify) {
00372                         int vrc = echo_page_debug_check(page,
00373                                                         ostid_id(&obj->ioo_oid),
00374                                                         res->lnb_file_offset,
00375                                                         res->lnb_len);
00376                         /* check all the pages always */
00377                         if (vrc != 0 && rc == 0)
00378                                 rc = vrc;
00379                 }
00380 
00381                 kunmap(page);
00382                 /* NB see comment above regarding persistent pages */
00383                 __free_page(page);
00384         }
00385 
00386         return rc;
00387 }
00388 
00389 static int echo_preprw(const struct lu_env *env, int cmd,
00390                        struct obd_export *export, struct obdo *oa,
00391                        int objcount, struct obd_ioobj *obj,
00392                        struct niobuf_remote *nb, int *pages,
00393                        struct niobuf_local *res)
00394 {
00395         struct obd_device *obd;
00396         int tot_bytes = 0;
00397         int rc = 0;
00398         int i, left;
00399         ENTRY;
00400 
00401         obd = export->exp_obd;
00402         if (obd == NULL)
00403                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00404 
00405         /* Temp fix to stop falling foul of osc_announce_cached() */
00406         oa->o_valid &= ~(OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS | OBD_MD_FLGRANT);
00407 
00408         memset(res, 0, sizeof(*res) * *pages);
00409 
00410         CDEBUG(D_PAGE, "%s %d obdos with %d IOs\n",
00411                cmd == OBD_BRW_READ ? "reading" : "writing", objcount, *pages);
00412 
00413         left = *pages;
00414         *pages = 0;
00415 
00416         for (i = 0; i < objcount; i++, obj++) {
00417                 int j;
00418 
00419                 for (j = 0 ; j < obj->ioo_bufcnt ; j++, nb++) {
00420 
00421                         rc = echo_map_nb_to_lb(oa, obj, nb, pages,
00422                                                res + *pages, cmd, &left);
00423                         if (rc)
00424                                 GOTO(preprw_cleanup, rc);
00425 
00426                         tot_bytes += nb->rnb_len;
00427                 }
00428         }
00429 
00430         atomic_add(*pages, &obd->u.echo.eo_prep);
00431 
00432         if (cmd & OBD_BRW_READ)
00433                 lprocfs_counter_add(obd->obd_stats, LPROC_ECHO_READ_BYTES,
00434                                     tot_bytes);
00435         else
00436                 lprocfs_counter_add(obd->obd_stats, LPROC_ECHO_WRITE_BYTES,
00437                                     tot_bytes);
00438 
00439         CDEBUG(D_PAGE, "%d pages allocated after prep\n",
00440                atomic_read(&obd->u.echo.eo_prep));
00441 
00442         RETURN(0);
00443 
00444 preprw_cleanup:
00445         /* It is possible that we would rather handle errors by  allow
00446          * any already-set-up pages to complete, rather than tearing them
00447          * all down again.  I believe that this is what the in-kernel
00448          * prep/commit operations do.
00449          */
00450         CERROR("cleaning up %u pages (%d obdos)\n", *pages, objcount);
00451         for (i = 0; i < *pages; i++) {
00452                 kunmap(res[i].lnb_page);
00453                 /* NB if this is a persistent page, __free_page() will just
00454                  * lose the extra ref gained above */
00455                 __free_page(res[i].lnb_page);
00456                 res[i].lnb_page = NULL;
00457                 atomic_dec(&obd->u.echo.eo_prep);
00458         }
00459 
00460         return rc;
00461 }
00462 
00463 static int echo_commitrw(const struct lu_env *env, int cmd,
00464                          struct obd_export *export, struct obdo *oa,
00465                          int objcount, struct obd_ioobj *obj,
00466                          struct niobuf_remote *rb, int niocount,
00467                          struct niobuf_local *res, int rc)
00468 {
00469         struct obd_device *obd;
00470         int pgs = 0;
00471         int i;
00472         ENTRY;
00473 
00474         obd = export->exp_obd;
00475         if (obd == NULL)
00476                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00477 
00478         if (rc)
00479                 GOTO(commitrw_cleanup, rc);
00480 
00481         if ((cmd & OBD_BRW_RWMASK) == OBD_BRW_READ) {
00482                 CDEBUG(D_PAGE, "reading %d obdos with %d IOs\n",
00483                        objcount, niocount);
00484         } else {
00485                 CDEBUG(D_PAGE, "writing %d obdos with %d IOs\n",
00486                        objcount, niocount);
00487         }
00488 
00489         if (niocount && res == NULL) {
00490                 CERROR("NULL res niobuf with niocount %d\n", niocount);
00491                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00492         }
00493 
00494         for (i = 0; i < objcount; i++, obj++) {
00495                 int verify = (rc == 0 &&
00496                              ostid_id(&obj->ioo_oid) != ECHO_PERSISTENT_OBJID &&
00497                               (oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS) != 0 &&
00498                               (oa->o_flags & OBD_FL_DEBUG_CHECK) != 0);
00499                 int j;
00500 
00501                 for (j = 0 ; j < obj->ioo_bufcnt ; j++, rb++) {
00502                         int vrc = echo_finalize_lb(oa, obj, rb, &pgs, &res[pgs],
00503                                                    verify);
00504                         if (vrc == 0)
00505                                 continue;
00506 
00507                         if (vrc == -EFAULT)
00508                                 GOTO(commitrw_cleanup, rc = vrc);
00509 
00510                         if (rc == 0)
00511                                 rc = vrc;
00512                 }
00513 
00514         }
00515 
00516         atomic_sub(pgs, &obd->u.echo.eo_prep);
00517 
00518         CDEBUG(D_PAGE, "%d pages remain after commit\n",
00519                atomic_read(&obd->u.echo.eo_prep));
00520         RETURN(rc);
00521 
00522 commitrw_cleanup:
00523         atomic_sub(pgs, &obd->u.echo.eo_prep);
00524 
00525         CERROR("cleaning up %d pages (%d obdos)\n",
00526                niocount - pgs - 1, objcount);
00527 
00528         while (pgs < niocount) {
00529                 struct page *page = res[pgs++].lnb_page;
00530 
00531                 if (page == NULL)
00532                         continue;
00533 
00534                 /* NB see comment above regarding persistent pages */
00535                 __free_page(page);
00536                 atomic_dec(&obd->u.echo.eo_prep);
00537         }
00538         return rc;
00539 }
00540 
00541 LPROC_SEQ_FOPS_RO_TYPE(echo, uuid);
00542 static struct lprocfs_vars lprocfs_echo_obd_vars[] = {
00543         { .name =       "uuid",
00544           .fops =       &echo_uuid_fops         },
00545         { NULL }
00546 };
00547 
00548 static int echo_setup(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00549 {
00550         int                     rc;
00551         __u64                   lock_flags = 0;
00552         struct ldlm_res_id      res_id = {.name = {1}};
00553         char                    ns_name[48];
00554         ENTRY;
00555 
00556         obd->u.echo.eo_obt.obt_magic = OBT_MAGIC;
00557         spin_lock_init(&obd->u.echo.eo_lock);
00558         obd->u.echo.eo_lastino = ECHO_INIT_OID;
00559 
00560         sprintf(ns_name, "echotgt-%s", obd->obd_uuid.uuid);
00561         obd->obd_namespace = ldlm_namespace_new(obd, ns_name,
00562                                                 LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER,
00563                                                 LDLM_NAMESPACE_MODEST,
00564                                                 LDLM_NS_TYPE_OST);
00565         if (obd->obd_namespace == NULL) {
00566                 LBUG();
00567                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00568         }
00569 
00570         rc = ldlm_cli_enqueue_local(obd->obd_namespace, &res_id, LDLM_PLAIN,
00571                                     NULL, LCK_NL, &lock_flags, NULL,
00572                                     ldlm_completion_ast, NULL, NULL, 0,
00573                                     LVB_T_NONE, NULL, &obd->u.echo.eo_nl_lock);
00574         LASSERT (rc == ELDLM_OK);
00575 
00576         obd->obd_vars = lprocfs_echo_obd_vars;
00577         if (lprocfs_obd_setup(obd) == 0 &&
00578             lprocfs_alloc_obd_stats(obd, LPROC_ECHO_LAST) == 0) {
00579                 lprocfs_counter_init(obd->obd_stats, LPROC_ECHO_READ_BYTES,
00580                                      LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX,
00581                                      "read_bytes", "bytes");
00582                 lprocfs_counter_init(obd->obd_stats, LPROC_ECHO_WRITE_BYTES,
00583                                      LPROCFS_CNTR_AVGMINMAX,
00584                                      "write_bytes", "bytes");
00585         }
00586 
00587         ptlrpc_init_client(LDLM_CB_REQUEST_PORTAL, LDLM_CB_REPLY_PORTAL,
00588                            "echo_ldlm_cb_client", &obd->obd_ldlm_client);
00589         RETURN(0);
00590 }
00591 
00592 static int echo_cleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
00593 {
00594         int leaked;
00595         ENTRY;
00596 
00597         lprocfs_obd_cleanup(obd);
00598         lprocfs_free_obd_stats(obd);
00599 
00600         ldlm_lock_decref(&obd->u.echo.eo_nl_lock, LCK_NL);
00601 
00602         /* XXX Bug 3413; wait for a bit to ensure the BL callback has
00603          * happened before calling ldlm_namespace_free() */
00604         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00605         schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
00606 
00607         ldlm_namespace_free(obd->obd_namespace, NULL, obd->obd_force);
00608         obd->obd_namespace = NULL;
00609 
00610         leaked = atomic_read(&obd->u.echo.eo_prep);
00611         if (leaked != 0)
00612                 CERROR("%d prep/commitrw pages leaked\n", leaked);
00613 
00614         RETURN(0);
00615 }
00616 
00617 struct obd_ops echo_obd_ops = {
00618         .o_owner           = THIS_MODULE,
00619         .o_connect         = echo_connect,
00620         .o_disconnect      = echo_disconnect,
00621         .o_init_export     = echo_init_export,
00622         .o_destroy_export  = echo_destroy_export,
00623         .o_create          = echo_create,
00624         .o_destroy         = echo_destroy,
00625         .o_getattr         = echo_getattr,
00626         .o_setattr         = echo_setattr,
00627         .o_preprw          = echo_preprw,
00628         .o_commitrw        = echo_commitrw,
00629         .o_setup           = echo_setup,
00630         .o_cleanup         = echo_cleanup
00631 };
00632 
00633 void echo_persistent_pages_fini(void)
00634 {
00635         int i;
00636 
00637         for (i = 0; i < ECHO_PERSISTENT_PAGES; i++)
00638                 if (echo_persistent_pages[i] != NULL) {
00639                         __free_page(echo_persistent_pages[i]);
00640                         echo_persistent_pages[i] = NULL;
00641                 }
00642 }
00643 
00644 int echo_persistent_pages_init(void)
00645 {
00646         struct page *pg;
00647         int          i;
00648 
00649         for (i = 0; i < ECHO_PERSISTENT_PAGES; i++) {
00650                 gfp_t gfp_mask = (i < ECHO_PERSISTENT_PAGES/2) ?
00651                         GFP_KERNEL : GFP_HIGHUSER;
00652 
00653                 pg = alloc_page(gfp_mask);
00654                 if (pg == NULL) {
00655                         echo_persistent_pages_fini();
00656                         return -ENOMEM;
00657                 }
00658 
00659                 memset (kmap (pg), 0, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00660                 kunmap (pg);
00661 
00662                 echo_persistent_pages[i] = pg;
00663         }
00664 
00665         return 0;
00666 }
